summary.overall_findings: Caterpillar's documented practices for responsible AI span both operational and policy levels, addressing 5 of 7 evaluated pillars. Operational practices include a human-in-the-loop architecture for AI recommendations, details on AI use cases in product development, and the establishment of an Intelligent Automation Center of Excellence. At the policy level, explainability is addressed through the right to object to automated decision-making, while privacy disclosures mention real-time, private interactions for the Cat AI Assistant. No qualifying public evidence was found for fairness or external accountability, based on a review of 9 publicly available sources.
